    • Method Detail

      • getContext

        public AcrossContext getContext()

      • setContext

        protected void setContext(AcrossContext context)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        True if this module will be bootstrapped if configured in an AcrossContext.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)

        A module can be attached to an AcrossContext but still not enabled. In that case it will not be bootstrapped and other enabled modules depending on this one will cause the entire bootstrap to fail (dependency misconfiguration).

        A disabled module still influences the boostrap order of modules (as if it would be enabled), but will otherwise have no further impact.

        By default a module is enabled.

      • getExtensionTargets

        public String[] getExtensionTargets()
        Returns an array of module names for which this module is an extension. Any non-empty array will effectively turn this module descriptor into a module extension.

        If more than one module name is specified, the first one present will be extended.

        Specifying extension targets does not impact dependencies, if the target of the extension is required, than it should also be specified using AcrossDepends.

        Returns:
        array of module names

      • getExposeFilter

        public BeanFilter getExposeFilter()
        Returns:
        The filter that beans should match to exposed to other modules in the AcrossContext.

      • setExposeFilter

        public void setExposeFilter(BeanFilter exposeFilter)
        Sets the filter that will be used after module bootstrap to copy beans to the parent context and make them available to other modules in the AcrossContext.
        Parameters:
        exposeFilter - The filter that beans should match to be exposed to other modules in the AcrossContext.

      • expose

        public void expose(Class<?>... classOrAnnotations)
        Expose beans matching any of the classes. If the class is an annotation, beans having the annotation will be matched, otherwise beans assignable to the target class will match.
        Parameters:
        classOrAnnotations - to match

      • exposeClass

        public void exposeClass(String... classNames)
        Expose beans matching any of the classes or annotations. If the class specified is not present on the classpath, it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        classNames - to add

      • expose

        public void expose(String... beanNames)
        Exposed all beans with the given names.
        Parameters:
        beanNames - that need to be exposed

      • getExposeTransformer

        public ExposedBeanDefinitionTransformer getExposeTransformer()
        Returns:
        The transformer that will be applied to all exposed beans before copying them to the parent context.

      • setExposeTransformer

        public void setExposeTransformer(ExposedBeanDefinitionTransformer exposeTransformer)
        Sets the transformer that will be applied to all exposed beans before actually copying them to the parent context.
        Parameters:
        exposeTransformer - The transformer that should be applies to all exposed beans.

      • getInstallerSettings

        public InstallerSettings getInstallerSettings()
        Gets the InstallerSettings attached to this module. If none are attached (default), this method will return null. No InstallerSettings mean the settings from the context will be used.
        Returns:
        InstallerSettings instance or null if none.

      • setInstallerSettings

        public void setInstallerSettings(InstallerSettings installerSettings)
        Sets the InstallerSettings for this module. Can be null (default) to ensure that the InstallerSettings from the context will be used.
        Parameters:
        installerSettings - InstallerSettings instance.

      • getInstallers

        public Object[] getInstallers()
        Signature is subject to change in the future, only class instances should be returned.
        Returns:
        Array containing the installer classes in the order of which they should be run.

      • getInstallerScanPackages

        public String[] getInstallerScanPackages()
        The collection of packages that should be scanned for Installer annotated classes. Defaults to the "installers" package relative to the package of the implementing class.

        Returns:
        Array of package names.
        See Also:
        registerDefaultInstallerContextConfigurers(Set)

      • getRuntimeDependencies

        public Collection<String> getRuntimeDependencies()
        Returns:
        Collection of dependencies added explicitly - outside of the module definition.

      • addRuntimeDependency

        public void addRuntimeDependency(String moduleName)
        Add an explicit required dependency for this module.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Name of the other module this module should depend on.

      • registerDefaultApplicationContextConfigurers

      • registerDefaultInstallerContextConfigurers

        protected void registerDefaultInstallerContextConfigurers(Set<ApplicationContextConfigurer> installerContextConfigurers)
        Register the default ApplicationContextConfigurer to be added to the global installer ApplicationContext for this module. This defaults to the "installers.config" package relative to the package of the implementing class.
        Parameters:
        installerContextConfigurers - Set of existing configurers to add to.

      • getResourcesKey

        public String getResourcesKey()
        The resources key is the key identifying the resources location for this module in the larger set of resources. By default it is the same as the module name, but it can be overridden to provide a simpler (eg lowercase) string.
        Specified by:
        getResourcesKey in interface AcrossModuleEntity
        Returns:
        Key (sub path) of the resources for this module.

      • getModuleConfigurationScanPackages

        public String[] getModuleConfigurationScanPackages()
        The collection of packages that should be scanned for module configurations. Defaults to the "extension" packages relative to the package of the implementing class.
        Returns:
        Array of package names.

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        An AcrossModule name should not contain any whitespace and should only be ASCII characters.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface AcrossModuleEntity
        Returns:
        Name of this module. Should be unique within a configured AcrossContext.

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription()
        Returns:
        Description of the content of this module.

      • prepareForBootstrap

        public void prepareForBootstrap(ModuleBootstrapConfig currentModule,
                                AcrossBootstrapConfig contextConfig)

        Called when a context is preparing to bootstrap, but before the actual bootstrap happens. This is the last chance for a module to modify itself or its siblings before the actual bootstrapping will occur.

        Only modules that will actually bootstrap will be available in the context configuration. Any disabled modules will not be present.

        Parameters:
        currentModule - Bootstrap configuration of the current module.
        contextConfig - Bootstrap configuration of the entire context.
